thread.title: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 6
thread.title_full: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 6 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 6
text:
Dorothy King Williams Willie B. Heyward Age: 69
Residence: Dorchester Waylyn
Occupation: Attorney
Education: BA, Political Science, UCLA; JD, University California, Hastings College of LawPolitical experience: None
Contact information: (843) 568-4679; (843) 225-8754; williefordistrict6@live.com
How I spend my spare time: Internet surfing and reading
What makes me qualified for this office: I believe that my experience as a lawyer helps me to make decisions based on consideration of the various facets of issues and to consider both the impact and consequences of decisions.
If elected, my top priority would be: I want to be elected to the North Charleston City Council to represent Council District 6 because I to would like to assist and help empower the residents of District 6 to better their community.
Dorothy King Williams Age: 68
Residence: Liberty Park-Highland Terrace
Occupation: North Charleston City Councilwoman
Education: N.C. State, associate’s degree
Political experience: 24 years on City Council
Contact information: (843) 735-1539, dwilliams0521@yahoo.com
How I spend my spare time: Reading, listening to jazz, spending time with family
What makes me qualified for this office: Listening to my constituents and willing to work hard and fight for what’s right. Being available and a voice 24/7. Accomplishing whatever I set out to do.
If elected, my top priority would be: working with the school system in establishing a trade school for all high school students; supermarket for the Southern side of the city; piping ditches and speed humps in my district.
Jesse E. Williams Age: 35
Residence: Dorchester Waylyn
Occupation: Financial consultant and tax preparer
Education: Charleston Southern University, Master of Business Administration
Political experience: None
Contact information: (843) 642-4233, jessefordistrict6@gmail.com
How I spend my spare time: Playing basketball, salsa dancing, and doing community outreach. What makes me qualified for this office: I am passionate about the community and I believe in North Charleston. I was Dorchester Waylyn Neighborhood president, served on the Board of LAMC, and I am a business owner.
If elected, my top priority would be: to deal with the drainage issues in North Charleston’s District 6. This is a priority because sanitation and quality of life must be improved.
